directions: Roast the cocoa beans in an oven at 250°F (120°C) for 25 minutes.
Remove the beans from the oven and let them cool.
Crack open the roasted cocoa beans and remove the shells.
Grind the cocoa nibs into a fine powder using a coffee grinder.
Place the cocoa powder in a heat-resistant bowl.
Melt the cocoa powder by placing it over a source of heat, such as a double boiler or a stove on low heat.
Stir the cocoa powder continuously until it forms a smooth liquid.
Pour the melted cocoa liquid into a container lined with cheesecloth or a fine strainer.
Allow the liquid to cool and solidify.
The solidified cocoa butter can be used for various culinary or cosmetic purposes.
